issue.title: INTEGRATION_world test failure on gazebo_2.1 branch

content.raw:
On my mac it fails at the same place in the test ([world.cc:57](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/bc556c87a28a89ea257cfa33c9a345a6b713197f/test/integration/world.cc?at=gazebo_2.1#cl-57)), but with a memory access error while the plugin is being destroyed:
~~~
Thread 52 (process 78599):
#0  0x000000011192c425 in ?? ()
Cannot access memory at address 0x11192c425
#1  0x000000011192242f in ?? ()
#2  0x0000000100381f51 in boost::detail::sp_counted_base::release () at /usr/local/Cellar/boost/1.54.0/include/boost/smart_ptr/detail/sp_counted_base_gcc_x86.hpp:146
#3  0x0000000100381f51 in boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::ModelPlugin>::~shared_ptr () at /usr/local/Cellar/boost/1.54.0/include/boost/smart_ptr/detail/shared_count.hpp:371

#15 0x000000010031b1e0 in gazebo::physics::Base::RemoveChild (this=0x1137321a0, _id=<value temporarily unavailable, due to optimizations>) at /Users/scpeters/ws/gazebo/src/gazebo/gazebo/physics/Base.cc:211
#16 0x00000001003c2251 in __gnu_cxx::__normal_iterator<boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::physics::Model>*, std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::physics::Model>, std::allocator<boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::physics::Model> > > >::operator++ () at /usr/include/c++/4.2.1/bits/stl_iterator.h:736
#17 0x00000001003c2251 in gazebo::physics::World::ClearModels (this=0x104839800) at /Users/scpeters/ws/gazebo/src/gazebo/gazebo/physics/World.cc:734

issue.title: INTEGRATION_world test failure on gazebo_2.1 branch

content.raw:
I've tried adding a destructor and explicitly disconnecting the diffdrive plugin update connection, but it never seems to stop the OnUpdate callback.

I think this bug is a problem in the Event class. It has been fixed in default, but with major refactoring that may be difficult to backport.

Should we just disable this test for the gazebo 2.x branches?
content.html:
I've tried adding a destructor and explicitly disconnecting the diffdrive plugin update connection, but it never seems to stop the OnUpdate callback.

I think this bug is a problem in the Event class. It has been fixed in default, but with major refactoring that may be difficult to backport.

Should we just disable this test for the gazebo 2.x branches?

issue.title: INTEGRATION_world test failure on gazebo_2.1 branch

content.raw: It is a good option, indeed. It is better not to have a test that a one that is always failing. I will take care of this.
content.html: It is a good option, indeed. It is better not to have a test that a one that is always failing. I will take care of this.

INTEGRATION_world test failure on gazebo_2.1 branch

content.raw: I''ve disable the tests in gazebo 2.2 jobs. Thanks for the work Steve!
content.html: I''ve disable the tests in gazebo 2.2 jobs. Thanks for the work Steve!
